updateMessage: Adds experimental support for US-style federal taxes (income tax + FICA + CGT) within FinSim.

incomeTax.name: Federal Income Tax
incomeTax.tooltip: US federal income tax on ordinary income (approximation with standard deduction embedded in brackets).

socialContributions.name: FICA
socialContributions.tooltip: Combined Social Security + Medicare employee payroll tax (approximate flat 7.65% with no wage cap).

capitalGainsTax.name: CGT
capitalGainsTax.tooltip: Approximate long-term capital gains tax on investments (single blended rate).

wizardHelp.label: Retirement Accounts
wizardHelp.contributionDescriptionP1:
How much of your age-dependent maximum you want to pay out of your gross salary into a private pension scheme.

If you enter 100% here, you will contribute the maximum allowed for your age as per the tax rules. Do not include employer matching contributions here; there's another place for that.
wizardHelp.contributionDescriptionP2:
How much of your partner's age-dependent maximum they want to pay out of their gross salary into their private pension scheme.

If you enter 100% here, your partner will contribute the maximum allowed for their age. This field is only used in two-person simulation mode.

investmentTypes.label: US Index Funds
investmentTypes.helpText: US Index Funds are subject to Capital Gains Tax upon sale. Long-term gains are typically taxed at a preferential rate compared to ordinary income.

investmentTypes.label: US Shares
investmentTypes.helpText: Individual shares are subject to Capital Gains Tax upon sale. Long-term gains are typically taxed at a preferential rate.

investmentTypes.label: RSUs
investmentTypes.helpText: RSUs are taxed as ordinary income at vesting. Subsequent gains on the sale of shares are subject to Capital Gains Tax.
